subject: RE: [junit] Missing Resources
msgSnippet: It appears you are right - I added the directory containing the resources to my classpath & it works. (Unfortunately, I still have the same problems with
messageBody:
It appears you are right - I added the directory containing the resources to my classpath & it works. (Unfortunately, I still have the same problems with uTest.)
Thanks for your help,
Scott

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Andrew Inggs [mailto:Andrew.Inggs@...]
> Sent: Thursday, July 12, 2001 9:25 AM
> To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [junit] Missing Resources
>
>
> Yes, getting the text TestRunner to work first sounds like a
> good idea.
>
> Maybe the problems are not JUnit related. Can you run similar code to
> what's in the tests outside of the test environment without problems?
>
> If you are compiling from within JBuilder, try compiling on
> the command
> line to ensure the CLASSPATH is the same when compiling and running.
>
> -- Andrew
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Clemmons, Scott [mailto:scott.clemmons@...]
> Sent: 12 July 2001 15:06
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] Missing Resources
>
>
> Sorry. Here you go:
> - JDK 1.3 on Windows NT
> - JUnit 3.7
> -
> CLASSPATH=.;D:\Progra~1\JBuilder\jdk1.3\lib;E:\GENI\dev\3rdpar
> ty\parser\xerc
> es\v1.4.0\xerces.jar;E:\GENI\dev\3rdparty\JUnit\3.7\junit.jar;
> E:/GENI/dev/bi
> n;E:\GENI\devTest\classes;E:\GENI\dev\3rdparty\logger\v1.0.4\l
> og4j-core.jar
> - I invoke "java junit.textui.TestRunner
> com.fnc.geni.apps.repository.AllTests" for the text-based TestRunner.
> - Yes, I can run test cases fine that don't utilize the Swing
> portion of the
> code that gets the Resource from the Resource Bundle. I've
> been using JUnit
> for about a week or two with uTest (JBuilder plug-in).
> Recently I added
> test cases that a) test the GUI portion of the code b)
> utilize the log4j
> logger, and that's when the problems started. I decided to
> get the JUnit
> TestRunner to work before tackling the uTest problems (which
> are similar).
>
> -Scott
>
